intro: Capsella origo, commonly known as the common mouse-ear. It is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia, belonging to the family Brassicaceae. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its small white or pale yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from spring to early summer. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
